title: The last time Manchester United started the season so badly they went to the pub for crisis talks
text:
Manchester United have endured their worst start to a league season for 30 years, and the last time that happened the squad went to the pub for crisis talks.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side have taken just nine points from their first eight games, one more than Ferguson's side had at that stage in the 1989-90 campaign.

On that occasion, captain Bryan Robson told the squad to go to the pub in order to sort out their differences.

In 1989, captain Bryan Robson took the Manchester United squad to the pub to sort out their differences after a frustrating start

Mark Hughes was amongst the United players involved in the disappointing start in 1989-90

Mike Phelan battles for the ball in the 1989-90 season, with United ending up finishing 13th

There were calls for Alex Ferguson to be sacked after United struggled in the 1989-90 season

As reported by The Sun, defender Viv Anderson said: 'In those days the manager needed the senior players to help him.

'Something had to be done — by us players, not the manager. So Robbo as captain and the senior players took it upon themselves to act.

United endured a difficult time in the 1989-90 campaign, including losing to Aston Villa

HOW UNITED COMPARE AFTER OPENING EIGHT LEAGUE GAMES 1989-90: Won: 2 Drawn: 2 Lost: 2 Points per game: 1 Final position: 13th 2019-20: Won: 2 Drawn: 3 Lost: 3 Points per game: 1.13

'Robbo, me, Steve Bruce, we took it upon ourselves to galvanise the boys and say, "Listen, our form is not acceptable. This is Manchester United. We need to step it up".

'So the order went out and we all headed out to a pub in the middle of town. We finished training, went straight from the old Cliff training ground, cabs home.

'We were going to be there for as long as it took to iron out the problems.'

That season, United ended up finishing in 13th place in the top flight. They did, however, win the FA Cup, beating Crystal Palace in the final.

United have won just two league games this season and face a daunting task on Sunday as they host league leaders Liverpool.

To make matters worse, Solskjaer's side will be without David de Gea and Paul Pogba against Liverpool, with both players ruled out due to injury.

Going into the fixture at Old Trafford, United are without a win in their last three games, and Solskjaer has much work to do in order to improve the club's fortunes.
